Cooper.Action: Steps up to help fix the ballplayers' broken-down bus engine despite being a stranger.
Light-heartedly jokes with the ballplayers through his son Murph's comment, showing friendliness and connection.
Shrugs off the gratitude with a playful comment about the ballplayers not winning, showing a casual, good-natured attitude.
Steps to the engine compartment and manages to start the seized diesel engine, helping the ballplayers resume their journey.
Acknowledges only 'a little' knowledge about diesels but successfully fixes the engine anyway.
Makes a shrugging comment about the ballplayers needing to win so his boys can see it, showing a casual confidence in his capabilities.
Gently corrects Donald when he complains about baseball, saying 'You ruin it for the boys when you talk like that.'
Shares a moment of silence with Donald after pointing out 'They didn't have any baseball at all when I was a kid.'
Accurately identifies the bright streak in the sky as a satellite, not a comet, demonstrating observational skill and knowledge.
Calmly manages a delicate conversation with his father-in-law about disappointing baseball, using past personal experience to defuse tension.
Turns around to break up an argument between his kids in the back seat.
Pulls away before Donald can continue his teasing about Murph's teacher.
Watches the burning fields thoughtfully, asks questions about blight, shows awareness of agricultural issues.
Takes responsibility to take the kids to school despite distractions.
Attempts to break up kids' argument while driving, demonstrating situational awareness.
Responds calmly to flat tire by instructing his son to get the spare and quickly adapts when it's not available, deciding to use the patch kit instead.
Does not check the patch kit beforehand; only realizes it might be missing after the flat tire, suggesting a lack of preparation.
Encourages Tom to find a solution on his own to patch the bike, emphasizing self-reliance.
Explains the meaning of Murph's law thoughtfully to Murph, correcting the misunderstanding and providing a positive interpretation.
Hears the low rumbling sound and reacts quickly by tackling Murph to the ground, protecting him from the low-flying airplane.
Initially sighs and looks down when the patch kit is missing, showing momentary resignation.
Hands the laptop and antenna to Murph and instructs her kindly, showing trust and cooperation.
Tells Tom to take the wheel and guides him patiently under pressure, showing trust and consideration.
Reassures children despite imminent danger; confidently states they haven't lost the drone; smiles to encourage them.
Focuses intently on laptop and hacking task, oblivious to surroundings and possibly to others' feelings.
Concentrates intensely on hacking into the drone’s control circuitry while navigating challenging terrain.
Remains confident and reassures Tom to keep moving despite uncertainty.
Successfully regains control of the drone just before losing it.
Fails to notice the impending cliff until Tom alerts him.
Encourages Murph to try flying the drone, patiently guiding him and sharing a joyful moment.
Answers boys' questions thoughtfully and shares information about the drone mission.
Plans to reprogram the drone's autopilot to help with socially responsible tasks like driving a tractor, showing practical concern and long-term care.
Engages in a friendly, polite manner with the school principal and teacher, smiles at Ms. Kelly, showing approachability and sincerity.
Challenges the principal's dismissive attitude about Tom's future, expressing protective concern and hope for his son.
Does not dismiss Murph's suggestion to let the drone go, considers her feelings before explaining, indicating tolerance and respect.
Identifies the drone's autopilot module and decides to reprogram it to be socially responsible, showing problem-solving and adaptability.

Engages with the school principal about his son's future but seems taken aback and challenges the principal's realistic but discouraging assessment, showing involvement but some surprise at the situation.
Challenges the principal's reductive evaluation of his son's future with sarcasm and frustration.
Leans back, showing resignation and swallowing his anger when faced with an unwinnable argument.
Engages with Ms. Kelly about the old textbook Murph brought, showing interest and concern about his daughter's education.
Uses sarcasm that provokes offense in Ms. Kelly, which could be seen as confrontational or lacking tact.
Uses sharp, pointed questions to expose the illogical nature of the principal's criteria for judging his son's future potential.
Responds to unwelcome judgments with controlled anger and keeps composure rather than escalating the situation.
Leans back and acknowledges he is unlikely to win the argument, showing realistic self-awareness.
Does not provide strong counterarguments or solutions to the principal’s position, ultimately withdrawing from the discussion.
Responds to Ms. Kelly's dismissal of technology by sharing his personal loss and the impact of lost medical technology on his family.
Swallows anger and restrains himself despite feeling hurt by Ms. Kelly's criticism.
Raises a rhetorical question about humanity parting ways, implying emotional pain and vulnerability.
PUNCHES the wheel in frustration after leaving the school, showing internal struggle but no outward kindness in that moment.
Uses knowledge of MRI technology to argue effectively against the dismissal of technological advances.
Responds calmly and pragmatically to a report of malfunctioning tractors by advising a simple power-down before further investigation.
Appears frustrated and overwhelmed emotionally, punching the wheel after a difficult encounter.
Responds to Riggs and assists by checking and fixing the malfunctioning auto-pilot on the combine harvester.
Lands plane and approaches local workers to offer help without hesitation.
Checks over an old plane thoroughly before flying it, requests airspace permission properly, and skillfully pilots the plane to land on a deserted roadway.
Inspects a malfunctioning combine harvester, identifies an autopilot fault code, and resets the computer to fix it.
Carefully retrieves the probe from the crater, ensuring safety despite minimal radiation, and places it securely on his plane.
Handles the probe with respect and curiosity, admiring its form and history rather than treating it dismissively.
Shares information and thoughts openly with Riggs while investigating the probe.
Continues to try working on the probe despite difficulties, showing persistence but also openness to admitting he cannot crack it open.
Encourages Murph's defense of his beliefs by saying 'Good boy.' after Murph hits a bully.
Patiently explains the technical situation to Murph, showing engagement with his son's curiosity.
Dismisses the probe's mission and information without much emotional engagement, deciding pragmatically to melt it down.
Conveys sympathy to Murph by saying 'I'm sorry, son.' when explaining the probe’s mission failed.
Modifies defibrillator to interface with the probe and successfully retrieves an image from damaged memory, showing technical skill and problem-solving.
Admits he does not know where the ice-covered planet is and shrugs it off, showing some uncertainty about the data.
Decides to scrap the probe for copper since there's no one to receive its data, demonstrating pragmatic decision-making under constraints.
Shakes head in disgust, expresses regret about past and current situation, shows concern that his son Tom doesn't care about missing opportunities.
Seems disengaged and exhausted, flops down fully clothed on bed, reflecting on life with apparent resignation.
Expresses frustration and disgust after a failed meeting at the school, acknowledges harsh realities pragmatically.
Shows awareness of his son's disinterest in education, which indicates understanding of the problem.
Reaction to the probe chirping is not immediately shown in this excerpt; no clear competent or incompetent action related to that.
Lies exhausted on bed, fully clothed, indicating possible overwhelm or resignation rather than active problem solving.
Immediately responds to his sons' distress in the middle of the night, investigates the source of discomfort, and engages with the problem.
Involves Murph (his daughter) in problem solving, listens to her suggestion and acts on it.
Tells Murph she is staying home to clean the house, despite Murph's disappointment.
Considers Murph's suggestion about salvaging something, thinks it over before acting.
Uses a fail-safe method to make the probe annoying enough to retrieve it.
Calmly decides to get some sleep despite the ongoing problem with the probe.
Ties a rope around the probe and retrieves it carefully using ear protection and a staked line.
Considers Murph's suggestion about salvaging something from the probe instead of dismissing it outright.
Flies the plane skillfully, spinning and taking off from a dusty runway.
Curses and immediately goes into the forest to look for Murph when he notices Murph is missing.
Warns Murph to be careful about the underground facility, showing concern for his safety.
Carefully investigates suspicious foliage and discovers a hidden chemical transport truck by methodically using his rifle to probe.
Realizes the 'tree' is actually a venting camouflage chimney stack by touching it and observing temperature.
Assesses the situation carefully upon encountering the robot and the underground facility, advising caution to Murph.
Shows some hesitation and spooked reaction when approaching the unknown robot, indicating momentary emotional discomfort.
Decides to leave the mysterious place despite Murph's protests, prioritizing safety.
Orders Murph to hit the robot in the neck, ignoring the robot's request to stop.
Tells a lie to Amelia Brand about just looking for salvage.
Immediately decides to leave upon sensing danger, showing caution and situational awareness.
Points a rifle at the robot after it attacks, attempts to defend himself and his son.
Ignores the robot's command and instructs Murph to hit the robot in a vulnerable spot, showing tactical thinking under pressure.
Physically confronts the robot despite being injured, showing resilience and courage.
Does not escalate conversation with Brand aggressively, attempts to explain his intentions.
Fails to recognize the robot's strength and the potential threat of the situation before approaching.
Does not respond to Brand's insults, remains silent instead of escalating conflict.
Warns Tars about being careful with a weapon, showing concern for his companion’s safety.
Backs away calmly instead of reacting aggressively when threatened.
Makes a sarcastic remark ('Now who's stealing from who?'), indicating a slightly confrontational attitude.
Asks who the people are, showing curiosity and openness in a tense situation.
Replies with straightforward answers to questions about the probe's origin and condition.
Remains calm and observant despite the high-pressure environment and unfamiliar setting.
Questions others confidently about the origin of the probe and indicates knowledge of locations like Galveston and Canaveral.
Appears stunned and unsure when first entering the underground facility.
States that he 'got something off of' the probe despite others being frustrated, demonstrating calmness under pressure.
Asks permission before using defibrillator, smiles at Brand to reassure her.
Engages cooperatively with Brand and the team, shares information openly.
Firmly resists being kept at the station, asserts his autonomy but calmly.
Assessing the probe, taking initiative to use a defibrillator to access data, and successfully extracting useful information from a noisy memory unit.
Confidently explaining the uniqueness of the ice-covered planet data and debating Brand on the mission's direction.
Standing ground against Brand's attempt to keep the team waiting, arguing that the mission cannot be endangered further.
Smiles while sharing technical knowledge about telemetry units, showing a light-hearted side.
Explains the robots' obsolescence to Murph patiently, engaging her curiosity.
Sarcastically questions Tars about keeping them locked in, showing frustration but not hostility.
Accurately predicts the telemetry board failure under high voltage, which is confirmed by the engineers and Case.
Laughs off Brand's professional role due to her appearance and armed status, showing a slight lapse in social awareness.
Analyzes the schematic and quickly identifies that the rocket design lacks the necessary thrust or fuel to reach Jupiter, demonstrating technical understanding and critical thinking.
Questions the intentions of Case after being told about the secret mission, showing awareness and cautiousness in trust decisions.
Rejects an important mission offer to stay with and care for his children, showing commitment and responsibility toward family.
Expresses self-doubt about his experience but listens thoughtfully to Case's encouragement.
Acknowledges lack of experience and training compared to others prepared for the mission.
Declines mission offer due to personal responsibilities despite it being an opportunity he waited for.
Expresses concern and hope about finding new technology to rebuild humanity.
Questions Brand about why she did not tell others about the blight earlier, showing frustration about the secrecy.
Pauses his argument when he realizes the difficult truth Brand states, showing tolerance and understanding.
Shows anger growing when hearing bleak prospects for humanity, indicating emotional engagement.
Observes the dying corn plants and correctly identifies that the blight has not yet affected corn but is spreading.
Challenges Brand on why the information about the blight was kept secret, indicating critical thinking and concern.
Acknowledges Brand's grim assessment silently, showing intellectual humility and realism.
Suggests hope by believing new technology will save humanity, demonstrating optimism but with some faith in progress.
Walks Murph back to the plane and carefully buckles her into her seat.
Carries his sleeping son into the house gently.
Shares his full situation and feelings openly with Donald.
Expresses concern and responsibility for looking after his boys despite the urgent mission.
Has a serious conversation with Brand, contemplates the mission's stakes thoughtfully.
Buckles Murph into the seat carefully, carries his son into the house gently, showing care and responsibility.
Struggles internally with the decision to leave his children but listens to Donald's advice about responsibility and preparation.
Gives his son Tom a hug before leaving.
Comforts Murph by putting an arm around him and encouraging him about important work at home.
Hands Murph his watch and asks him to hold onto it, symbolizing trust and connection.
Promises Murph he will come back, providing reassurance despite the evident sadness.
Breaks the hug with Murph reluctantly and leaves, initiating a painful separation.
Comforts his son Murph despite his own emotional pain, demonstrates thoughtfulness by entrusting Murph with the watch as a meaningful token.
Acknowledges the difficulty of leaving but remains firm in his decision to proceed with the mission, showing resolve and confidence.
Does not try to dissuade or explain detailed plans to Murph, potentially missing an opportunity to prepare or reassure his child more fully.
Engages in playful banter with Tars, appreciating humor and suggesting features to improve communication.
Looks confused at Tars and Doyle's interaction but remains engaged without dismissiveness.
Does not respond negatively to Brand's lack of returned greeting, continuing interaction professionally.
Quickly understands Tars' sarcasm and responds with humor, recognizing the need for a cue light to identify jokes, showing social and situational awareness.
Seems confused at first by Tars' humor, requiring explanation from Doyle, indicating a slight delay in reading social cues.
Efficiently adapts to new environment by immediately looking for a place to put his things, showing situational awareness and readiness.
Engages with Brand about telemetry boards and supplies, showing proactive involvement in mission preparations and resourcefulness.
Follows Brand underwater without hesitation, showing support and willingness to engage in difficult tasks alongside her.
Stops breathing underwater momentarily but recovers and hurries to catch up with Brand, showing attentiveness and concern for the mission and partner.
Hastily fits his rebreather and follows Brand underwater, quickly adapting to an unfamiliar and challenging environment.
Forgets to breathe while focused on swimming after Brand, showing a momentary lapse in situational awareness.
Remembers to breathe again and hurries to catch up with Brand, recovering quickly from the lapse.
Holds the light steadily to assist Brand as she disassembles the missile and removes the telemetry board, cooperating effectively.
Struggles to keep pace with Brand through the lab while dripping wet, indicating physical strain but determination to continue.
Engages in conversation with Brand, shows curiosity about ant colonies and gravity.
Nods at Brand when she enters the room, attempts a social acknowledgment.
Brand ignores his nod; Cooper does not respond negatively or insist.
Asks intelligent questions about the experiment and mission parameters, showing curiosity and engagement.
Looks at ant colonies and reflects thoughtfully on their hard work, indicating observational skills and understanding.
Engages in brief exchanges but is somewhat dismissed by Brand, which might suggest a slight lack of social assertiveness or confidence.
Passively watches mission data presentation without contributing insights or challenges.
Asks clear and relevant questions about the mission, such as 'Lose time?' and 'How much time?'
Engages attentively with technical explanations about gravity and time dilation during the mission briefing
Responds to Brand's hopeful assumption with a bleak comment about humanity eating all animals once food runs out.
Speaks sarcastically to Tars, showing lighthearted engagement.
Watches quietly as Brand's Father continues work without interrupting.
Watches Brand's Father hug his daughter and observes her sadness; tries to reassure Brand by saying 'We'll be back.'
Begins to speak but stops as the rocket engine fires, showing restraint or hesitation.
Straps himself into the seat confidently next to Brand and attempts to reassure her despite her emotional state by saying 'We'll be back.'
Begins to say something important but stops, showing self-restraint and situational awareness as the rocket engines fire.
Laughs warmly at Tars's small new body and affectionately says 'Good morning, sunshine.'
Teases Tars by calling the small body 'a bit of a demotion,' showing lighthearted friendliness.
Skillfully installs Tars's chip into the new robot body and initiates activation.
Shows confident curiosity and engagement in unfamiliar, advanced technology without hesitation.
Watches Tars painting the communications relay and engages in light teasing, calling Tars 'bashful' and making a slightly sarcastic remark.
Begins hauling gear inside the compact ship without hesitation.
Expresses surprise at the ship's small size, showing situational awareness but also a momentary underestimation.
Observes Tars' unusual behavior and questions it, showing attentiveness and understanding of technical tasks.
Watches a video message from his son Tom, showing concern and attentiveness to his family despite the distance.
Stares silently at the darkened screen after the video cuts out, reflecting on fractured family relations but does not react with bitterness.
Works cooperatively and silently alongside crew members to move heavy colonization equipment, matching pace and showing willingness to help.
Reacts quickly to prevent potential damage to ship by catching a heavy spinning bundle, showing responsibility and care for collective safety.
Watches Tars carefully and copies his procedure to stow equipment, improving speed with practice.
Asks about the mass of the equipment to better understand handling in zero gravity.
Attempts to stop a heavy spinning bundle, momentarily catches his hand and jerks it away, nearly causing damage to the hull.
Smiles in response to Brand's friendliness, showing receptivity and a positive reaction to social warmth.
Shows embarrassment when questioned about mood, indicating self-awareness and sensitivity to social dynamics.

Responds to Case's psychological observations with dry humor and mild sarcasm ('You worry about my hand and I'll worry about my mood.' / 'Did they program you to be condescending?'), which may distance him from others but also shows engagement and wit.
Remains calm and composed while bleeding, allows Case to sew his hand with precise stitches, and interacts with Case with a dry sense of humor.
Questions the value of humans on the mission despite the risks, showing critical thinking and skepticism.
Is momentarily embarrassed about his injury but quickly regains composure and confidently responds to Case’s observations about mood and psychology.
Hesitates but chooses to hear the emotional truth about seeing his children before death, showing openness to vulnerability.
Looks away, overcome with emotion when confronted with his feelings, indicating sincerity and depth of feeling.
Begins recording a heartfelt message expressing love for his children and hopes for their future, demonstrating sincerity and emotional warmth.
Erases the recorded message and refrains from sending it, possibly showing restraint or an inability to fully share his feelings at that moment, indicating some emotional guardedness.
Hesitates and is visibly affected emotionally by Case's explanation about survival and programming, showing vulnerability.
Despite discomfort, chooses to continue the difficult conversation to gain knowledge.
Begins recording a personal message to his children with an uncertain demeanor, then erases it, indicating self-doubt or hesitation.
Smiles, grateful for Brand's small kindness and thanks her sincerely.
Looks thoughtfully at the holographic model of the black hole system and comments on the ice planet's precarious orbit, showing awareness of the environment before making decisions.
Expresses skepticism about the plan's viability ('I guess I just think we're on our own.'), indicating critical thinking but also possible doubt impacting confidence.
Moves promptly to the communications touchscreen to deploy the comms relay when reaching the wormhole, demonstrating readiness and quick response to mission tasks.
Watches communications screen attentively and follows orders to prepare for transit through the wormhole by helping fold away equipment and moving to the outer layer of the ship.
Takes a deep breath and watches his crew member Doyle get swallowed into the compressing ship with concern.
Firmly declines TARS's offer to make a joke during a tense moment.
Smiles at himself despite the unnerving and claustrophobic experience.
Notices and reports unusual distortion on the hull despite system displays showing integrity is fine.
Expresses uncertainty and defers interpretation of strange phenomena to others.
Holds his breath and watches the sphere distort his arm, showing calm observation under extraordinary circumstances.
Asks if the sphere can be asked to stop, demonstrating presence of mind and attempt to interact logically with the unknown.
Pulls himself to the comms post and announces the communication relay is working, sharing good news with the crew.
Pings the relay left on the far side of the wormhole and successfully receives a response, confirming communication with Earth
Drags himself along the hull to reach the controls after losing contact, shows persistence and responsibility.
Alerted by the communication loss and shares information with crew calmly.
Distracted with Case at the comm screen, not noticing Doyle's sabotage attempt.
Tries to understand Roth's suggestion about using full engine power to escape the black hole's gravity.
Relies on others (Tars, Roth) to take critical technical actions without intervening directly himself here.
Expresses concern about Tars during the engine explosion.
Looks at Doyle with rising anger but then looks down quietly.
Looks at Doyle with anger rising and then looks down after Tars is lost, showing emotional restraint and focus in a critical situation.
Tries repeatedly to establish communication with Earth, shows concern about the lack of contact.
Attempts to engage Brand about her emotional state, showing sensitivity although she dismisses him.
Questions the decision to bring Doyle on the landing module, indicating care or concern for the group dynamics or safety.
Tries repeatedly and persistently to contact the relay despite failure.
Questions the implausibility of probes landing all in one place, showing critical thinking.
Challenges Brand's decision to bring Doyle along, indicating situational awareness and concern.
Does not give up or panic when communication fails; remains engaged and proactive.
Steps aside to allow Doyle onboard without hesitation, facilitating the mission's cooperation.
Takes initiative to investigate a small mound with a folding shovel, showing proactive problem-solving.
Systematically digs around and hacks away at the hillside, revealing a metal door and uncovering a hidden shelter.
Cuts away the mound to reveal fabric and identifies the flag of the People's Republic of China, showing awareness and attention to detail.
Continues to explore by forcing open a second door on the ice planet, demonstrating persistence and initiative.
Steps back, realizing the significance of the Taichung mission; shares information with Brand about the mission's true nature.
Initially offers to help Brand with taking samples but then refrains from speaking up (bites his tongue).
Emerges carrying several containers of Brand's equipment through harsh conditions, helping the team.
Identifies the significance of the Chinese base camp and correctly deduces it is the Taichung mission, demonstrating insight and intelligence.
Examines the relay log carefully to extract accurate information about the mission's history and status.
Initially volunteers to assist Brand with ice drilling but then hesitates and does not immediately help, showing some lack of assertiveness in a critical moment.
Despite struggling with physical equipment in harsh conditions, he perseveres and manages to carry Brand's containers through difficult terrain, demonstrating determination and functional skill.
Recognizes and solemnly acknowledges the fallen crew by uncovering their grave markers and stating their number aloud.
Engages with team members calmly to understand the danger and considers options for survival without panic or selfishness.
Recognizes the significance of the grave markers and comprehends the severity of the situation.
Trips over a small, easy-to-miss object while moving through the snow, dropping equipment.
Asks sensible questions about their remaining options, such as inquiring about returning to the ship.
Looks at Doyle, then follows Brand down into the ice mine shaft, showing decisiveness and willingness to engage in a dangerous task.
Takes over the pick from Brand when she exhausts herself, demonstrating situational awareness and readiness to act.
Warns Case to stop punching the ice to prevent breaking through.
Falls into cavern following Case calmly, shows no panic.
Removes helmet and struggles underwater to survive, showing self-preservation.
Warning Case to stop punching the ice as a fissure opens beneath them.
Relies on suit’s automated safety features (drag chute and airbags) that deploy just before impact, surviving a long fall.
Displays presence of mind underwater despite suit failure by removing helmet and suit parts, then swimming upward to survive.
Encourages Brand to breathe and trust him despite danger; rescues her repeatedly underwater.
Offers Brand a hand after they reach shore, showing concern and willingness to help.
Uses dry humor to lighten the mood ('I thought we were supposed to be a collective organism.'), fostering connection.
Lets go of Brand when struggling to hold her, but gives warnings and instructions to maximize her survival chances.
Removes helmet and tears off suit to escape drowning underwater, then surfaces and assesses the situation calmly.
Identifies Brand's suit is compromised and instructs her to breathe, reassures her during a crisis.
Realizes he will have to let go of Brand to avoid drowning himself, communicates clearly to prepare her.
Dives back underwater to remove Brand’s stuck suit seals despite danger and exhaustion.
Offers Brand help after escaping, maintains teamwork mindset despite her initial refusal.
Responds politely with 'Don't mention it' when thanked by Brand.
Helps pull gear and build shelter with others.
Shows concern by asking if Brand has returned and telling others to call her back before nightfall.
Does not dismiss Brand's decision to stay behind despite risks; instead goes to search for her.
Helps pull teammates out of the water and assists in setting up shelter efficiently using modular equipment.
Suggests a logical plan to climb back to the ice to get a fourth suit and organizes equipment storage.
Expresses skepticism about Brand's theory but remains observant and cautious.
Leaves to find Brand when she goes off alone, demonstrating responsibility and initiative.
Shows concern for safety by wanting to return before nightfall.
Appears nervous and embarrassed when questioned by Brand.
Challenges Brand's optimism, expresses skepticism rather than blind faith.
Does not escalate conflict after Brand becomes angry, remains calm.
Scans the jungle environment carefully while Brand collects samples, showing situational awareness and caution.
Expresses nervousness about potential danger and suggests returning before night falls, demonstrating prudent judgment and risk assessment.
Stops scanning and becomes embarrassed when Brand calls out his nervousness, indicating a moment of self-doubt or loss of composure.
Challenges Brand's optimistic assumptions about the safety of the environment, reflecting critical thinking rather than blind faith.
Fails to reassure Brand or provide a confident alternative plan, allowing tension to rise without resolution.
Looks spooked but listens to Brand's advice and holds very still.
Questions Brand with 'What's that supposed to mean?'
Questions unusual phenomena calmly and tries to understand environment.
Steps back cautiously when confronted with unfamiliar life-form.
Appears spooked and unsure about the nature of the environment around him.
Tries his best to seem non-threatening when encountering the creature.
Quickly shifts from greeting to running when threatened, prioritizing safety over confrontation.
Leads Brand through danger, showing protective and guiding behavior.
Tries his best to seem non-threatening to an unknown creature, using calm speech before deciding to run when it becomes dangerous.
Immediately recognizes the threat and quickly initiates retreat, showing situational awareness and leadership by directing Brand to run.
Leads Brand through chaotic and dangerous terrain towards shelter, maintaining focus under pressure.
Clear communication to proceed towards shelter, directing others amidst danger.
Catches Brand as she slides past in the rushing water and says 'I've got you.'
Frantically looks around the cave and picks up a rock but does not act aggressively when Brand stops him.
Forces his way between two creatures and falls into the water, then manages to grab a tree branch and Brand to prevent falling further.
Looks around frantically in the cave and picks up a rock impulsively while creatures gather at the entrance.
Stands still and allows alien creatures to examine and probe him despite discomfort, trying to remain calm.
Questions and challenges the idea of cooperation when it seems to put him in danger.
Stands stock still and remains calm while alien creatures surround and probe him, resisting panic and sudden movements.
Questions the behavior of the organisms and tries to understand the situation instead of acting irrationally.
Verbally protests when the organism probes his mouth, showing some loss of composure.
Fails to prevent the organisms from probing him and showing vulnerability in the situation.
Makes an observational comment about the creatures having a long way to go, demonstrating understanding of their development stage.
Asks a relevant question about what the creatures are competing for, showing curiosity and analytical thinking.
Relies on Brand's explanations without providing deeper insight into the creatures' behavior himself.
Shares a vulnerable memory of famine and loss of faith in help, showing honest reflection and emotional depth.
Expresses skepticism and distrust about others' intentions to help, revealing a protective but somewhat closed-off attitude.
Questions the optimistic assumption that someone might be trying to help humanity and reflects on harsh personal experience to inform his skepticism.
Expresses doubt about hopeful plans without concrete evidence, relying instead on observed reality and experience.
Looks wary of the plants and stops at a sheer cliff, showing caution and attentiveness to surroundings.
Comments dryly that the Chinese 'lost' after seeing the destroyed colony, showing dark humor but no evident warmth.
Carefully examines the lab and ball of matter, noticing details such as the walls bowed inward and the layers of the ball's material, showing observational skill and curiosity.
Questions what was being tested in the damaged lab and notes the flattened steel chair layer, indicating analytical thinking.
Asks why the colonists didn't come despite the prepared barracks, showing concern and critical thinking about the mission context.
Cautiously advises Roth not to activate the unknown machine until they understand it.
Steps in to assist Case with decrypting the logs and ultimately gets the terminal working.
Warns Roth not to turn on an unknown device before understanding its function.
Identifies the encryption on the Chinese mission logs as old military-grade and not robust.
Quickly hacks into the encrypted terminal and forces it open by physically smashing a chip on the motherboard.
Speaks gently to Brand trying to comfort her despite his own doubts.
Asks clear, relevant questions about the planet's longevity and the situation, showing awareness and engagement.
Gently suggests a hopeful explanation to Brand even though he himself doubts it, demonstrating emotional intelligence and leadership.
Observes and correctly identifies the cause of the rumble as Roth and the unusual gravitational effect experienced by the crew.
Seems uncertain internally about the situation but maintains composure and takes initiative in investigation.
Quickly instructs others to hold onto something and helps Brand up after they fall and hit the ceiling.
Attempts to assist Doyle during a dangerous situation but slips and is pulled through the door while Brand tries to reach him.
Works collaboratively and supports team efforts to disable the machine, communicates clearly to teammates.
Looks over others' shoulders with interest, showing engagement and respect for their work.
Asks insightful questions about the technology and expresses skepticism about how quickly it could have been developed, showing critical thinking.
Looks thoughtfully at Brand and the device, indicating engagement and consideration of the implications.
Comforts Brand by acknowledging her feelings and trying to provide reassurance about their situation.
Places a hand on Brand's shoulder and calmly advises her and others not to make sudden movements to avoid provoking hostile forces.
Consoles Brand by acknowledging the difficulty of the situation and supports the team’s plan.
Observes movement and calmly instructs others not to make sudden movements, indicating situational awareness and control under pressure.
Tells Sergeant Liu the government is gone and further orders are not coming, bluntly stating they are on their own.
Takes a sidelong glance at Brand indicating concern that they won't be allowed to leave.

Clearly assesses the political situation and tries to convey the harsh reality to the Chinese officer: 'Further orders aren't coming. Your government is gone. It ran out of money, same as ours. You're on your own.'
Recognizes the futility in trying to negotiate further when he says quietly to Brand: 'They're never going to let us go.'
Nods in acknowledgment and takes leadership to lead others to the lander, ensuring their safety.
Watches Case and others fight and then helps gather Brand and the others to continue moving forward without hesitation.
Nods to Case's command and takes charge by grabbing Brand and others to move quickly.
Picks up the rifle from a fallen marine and leads the hiking effort up the mountain.
Watches Case fight rather than intervening, continuing to move the group to safety.
Fires on a marine to protect the team and others.
Catches Brand's eye when she is concerned about the fractal wildlife, showing some acknowledgement of her feelings.
Raises his weapon and fires at an emerging threat decisively, protecting the group.
Quickly assesses the damaged hull and fuel supply, understanding the impact on their ability to leave.
Acknowledges their predicament calmly after realizing they are stuck.
Helps assemble the escape rocket and rigs up a connection to transfer the operating code to the probe to assist Roth in his mission.
Looks at the probe filling with data without any evident impatience or frustration, showing support for Roth's risky one-way trip.
Drags and assembles a crude two-stage rocket semi-automatically, demonstrating technical skill and problem-solving under pressure.
Remembers an important item (the probe) and rigs a connection to transfer operating code, showing foresight and technical knowledge.
Implements a workaround to preserve crucial data despite limitations (garbled code), indicating adaptive intelligence and confidence.
Offers to take a dangerous task himself ('Let me take it').
Helps Roth into the rocket, assists teammates.
Runs out with Doyle to rescue the injured Case despite harsh conditions.
Volunteers to take control of a critical task despite being told not to, showing confidence and willingness to act.
Checks the hull of the lander and confirms it is intact before proceeding, demonstrating thoroughness and skill.
Raises rifle cautiously at unidentified figure approaching in a snowstorm, showing alertness and readiness to respond to threats appropriately.
